docs.abstract: The psychological devastation of the Civil War was much more widespread than we think.

docs.lead_paragraph: Surprising new research shows a small but diverse community of bacteria lives in the placentas of healthy pregnant women, overturning the belief that fetuses grow in a pretty sterile environment.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Spanish university is investigating how dozens of bodies donated to medical science came to be piled up in a campus basement, following newspaper publication of grotesque images of the remains dumped in what the daily said resembled a chamber of horrors.

headline.main: Spanish University to Probe 'Horror Chamber' Find
headline.print_headline: Spanish University to Probe 'Horror Chamber' Find

docs.lead_paragraph: American children are scoring failing marks in fitness because of the lure of the Internet, time-pressed parents and the culture of the car, fitness experts say.

docs.lead_paragraph: The board of AstraZeneca on Monday rejected the improved $119 billion takeover offer from U.S. drugmaker Pfizer, a decision that caused a sharp slide in the U.K. company's share price as many investors think it effectively brings an end to the protracted and increasingly bitter takeover saga.

headline.main: AstraZeneca Rejects $119 Billion Offer From Pfizer
headline.print_headline: AstraZeneca Rejects $119 Billion Offer From Pfizer

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. drugmaker Pfizer said Sunday that it has raised its offer for British rival AstraZeneca for a third time, hiking its stock-and-cash offer by 15 percent to $118.8 billion, or 70.73 billion pounds.

headline.main: Pfizer Ups Offer for AstraZeneca Again, to $119B
headline.print_headline: Pfizer Ups Offer for AstraZeneca Again, to $119B

docs.snippet: U.S. drugmaker Pfizer said Sunday that it has raised its offer for British rival AstraZeneca for a third time, hiking its stock-and-cash offer by 15 percent to $118.8 billion, or 70.73 billion pounds.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nick Auden didn't live to see the legislation, but the case of the Denver melanoma patient who died while seeking access to an experimental drug helped inspire a first-of-its kind law in Colorado.

headline.main: States Move to Expand Experimental Drugs for Some
headline.print_headline: States Move to Expand Experimental Drugs for Some

docs.snippet: Nick Auden didn't live to see the legislation, but the case of the Denver melanoma patient who died while seeking access to an experimental drug helped inspire a first-of-its kind law in Colorado.

docs.lead_paragraph: Amine Baba-Ali was wrongly convicted of an unspeakable crime, alleged in a divorce battle, but the evidence shows that the only atrocity was an official one.

headline.main: He Lost 3 Years and a Child, but Got No Apology
headline.print_headline: He Lost 3 Years and a Child in a Wrongful Conviction, but Got No Apology

docs.abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column; Amine Baba-Ali was wrongly convicted of unspeakable crime of raping his 4-year-old daughter, alleged in a divorce battle, but evidence shows that only atrocities were legal ones; has just settled lawsuit with New York State over his wrongful conviction, and will be paid $1.25 million.
docs.snippet: Amine Baba-Ali was wrongly convicted of an unspeakable crime, alleged in a divorce battle, but the evidence shows that the only atrocity was an official one.
